gov.va.vinci.leo.cr

Class BaseFileCollectionReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.uima.resource.Resource_ImplBase
      • org.apache.uima.resource.ConfigurableResource_ImplBase
        • org.apache.uima.collection.CollectionReader_ImplBase
          • gov.va.vinci.leo.cr.BaseLeoCollectionReader
            • gov.va.vinci.leo.cr.BaseFileCollectionReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LeoCollectionReaderInterface, org.apache.uima.collection.base_cpm.BaseCollectionReader, org.apache.uima.collection.CollectionReader, org.apache.uima.resource.ConfigurableResource, org.apache.uima.resource.Resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileCollectionReader, XmiFileCollectionReader

    public abstract class BaseFileCollectionReader
extends BaseLeoCollectionReader
    Get a list of the files in a directory and return them one at a time. Optionally a recurse flag can also be set which causes the reader to search recursively through the entire folder structure of the parent directory.
    Author:
    thomasginter

    • Field Detail

      • mInDir

        protected File mInDir
        Input Directory File object to be searched for available files.

      • mRecurse

        protected boolean mRecurse
        Recurse flag we will search recursively in sub-directories if true. Defaults to false.

      • mFileIndex

        protected int mFileIndex
        Index of the next file to be processed.

      • mFileCollection

        protected ArrayList<File> mFileCollection
        Array of File objects being processed.

      • mEncoding

        protected String mEncoding
        Encoding type for the files being read in. Defaults to system default.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseFileCollectionReader

        public BaseFileCollectionReader()
        Default constructor used during UIMA initialization.

      • BaseFileCollectionReader

        public BaseFileCollectionReader(File inputDirectory,
                        boolean recurse)
        Constructor that sets the input directory to be searched and the recurse flag that controls whether or not the reader will descend in to subdirectories.
        Parameters:
        inputDirectory - Input directory to be searched
        recurse - Recurse flag will descend into subdirectories if true, defaults to false.

      • BaseFileCollectionReader

        public BaseFileCollectionReader(File inputDirectory,
                        boolean recurse,
                        org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.SuffixFileFilter filter)
        Initialize with the input directory to be searched, recurse flag for parsing into subdirectories, and file name filter to be used.
        Parameters:
        inputDirectory - Input directory to be searched
        recurse - Recurse flag will descend into subdirectories if true, defaults to false
        filter - FileName extention filter to use, if null defaults to .txt

      • BaseFileCollectionReader

        public BaseFileCollectionReader(File inputDirectory,
                        String encoding,
                        boolean recurse,
                        org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.SuffixFileFilter filter)
        Initialize with the input directory to be searched, recurse flag for parsing into subdirectories, and file name filter to be used.
        Parameters:
        inputDirectory - Input directory to be searched
        encoding - Encoding format to use when reading in the data
        recurse - Recurse flag will descend into subdirectories if true, defaults to false
        filter - FileName extention filter to use, if null defaults to .txt

      • initialize

                throws org.apache.uima.resource.ResourceInitializationException
        This method is called during initialization, and does nothing by default. Subclasses should override it to perform one-time startup logic.

      • findFiles

        protected void findFiles(File f)
        Find the list of files that meet the requirements.
        Parameters:
        f - the file to search. This should be a directory.

      • setInputDirectory

        public void setInputDirectory(File inputDirectory)
        Set the inputDirectory for this FileSubReader object.
        Parameters:
        inputDirectory - the input directory to load files from.

      • setRecurseFlag

        public void setRecurseFlag(boolean recurse)
        Set the recurse flag for this property. The recurse flag controls whether or not this reader will recurse through subdirectories to find files or simply search the parent directory alone.
        Parameters:
        recurse - if true, sub directories are also searched, otherwise just the specified directory is used for input.

      • getCollectionSize

        public int getCollectionSize()
        Return the number of documents in the set.
        Returns:
        the size of the collection.

      • getCurrentIndex

        public int getCurrentIndex()
        Returns:
        the index of the current document in the collection.

        public boolean hasNext()
                throws IOException,
                       org.apache.uima.collection.CollectionException
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface org.apache.uima.collection.base_cpm.BaseCollectionReader
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        true if there is another document in the collection, false if not.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error reading the data.

      • produceCollectionReader

        public org.apache.uima.collection.CollectionReader produceCollectionReader()
                                                                    throws org.apache.uima.resource.ResourceInitializationException
        Create a map of parameter names and values from the parameters in the static inner Param class as well as class field variables. Then return a CollectionReader which has been initialized by the framework using the parameter settings provided.
        Returns:
        CollectionReader object.
        Throws:
        org.apache.uima.resource.ResourceInitializationException - if there is an error initializing the CollectionReader.
